result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: with JI's
Criminal Case Settlement

Cases 16CF74 & 16CM154 called together at 2:38 pm [Clerk SH] (Cases were scheduled for STC)
Defendant Cayli R. Peterson in court, in-custody, with Attorney Whitney Hagemann. ADA Monica J. Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Constitutional rights given; plea of "No Contest" entered on Count #2-16CF74; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; Court finds the plea has been entered freely, voluntarily, intelligently and accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders JOC entered.
On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Count #
1-16CF74 and Case #16CM154

On Count #2-16CF74, the Court withholds sentence, places Defendant on Probation for 3 years, with conditions:
--AODA Assessment & Follow Through with any recommended treatment
--To undergo any other type of assessment, treatment or counseling as required per Agent
--Random drug and/or alcohol screening
--To obtain/maintain employment and/or education program or combination of the two, per Agent
--No possession or consumption of illegal drugs
--Take any and all prescribed medications only as prescribed by treating physician
--No contact with any known drug offender except for treatment purposes or as deemed appropriate per Agent
--No contact with Matthew Traver, unless approved by the Department of Corrections
--No possession of any syringes or needles, except as deemed necessary for medical purposes by her Agent
--To pay $50 drug testing fee
--To pay statutory costs, fees and surcharges, including DNA Surcharge
--To submit DNA Sample upon demand

Days credit for time already served: 35 days
Felony Firearm/Voting Prohibitions Warnings Form Given
Recess: 2:52 pm
Status conference on July 5, 2016 at 02:30 pm.

Cases 16CF74 and 16CM154 called together at 8:38am 
Defendant Cayli R. Peterson in court, in custody with Attorney Whitney Hagemann.   ADA Brookellen Teuber appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty. Hagemann indicates that resolution was expected today, but assigned prosecutor has indicated that victim rights has not been complied with
ADA Teuber gives reasoning for lack of victim rights compliance

The Court directs the Court's JA to schedule a status conference out 3 weeks
recess: 8:43am

NEXT: JA to schedule a STC (anticipated plea/sentencing) out 3 weeks (as close to 3 weeks as possible)
Status conference on June 14, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Cases 16CF74 and 16CM154 called together at 8:36am [mo]
Defendant Cayli R. Peterson in court, in custody with Attorney Whitney Hagemann.   ADA Theresa Beck appears for the State of Wisconsin.

As to Case 16CF74:
Ms.Peterson waives her right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds her over for Trial.

Arraignment:
--service of Information admitted, reading waived
--the charges and maximum penalties are recited
--pleas of "not guilty" entered


The Court and Counsel discuss scheduling; request STC be rescheduled to an earlier date of the one scheduled, in anticipation will become a plea/sentencing. 

As to the Defendant's Motion for Bond Modification:
--Atty. Hagemann withdraws the motion
--no objection from ADA Beck
--the Court allows the Motion to be withdrawn; bond remains as fixed

recess: 8:39am
NEXT:   As to Both Cases: Status Conference on 6/14/16 at 8:30am (likely plea and sentencing) [note: Court did not cancel the other scheduled STC]
for bond modification
Defendant's
Status conference on July 8, 2016 at 11:00 am.
Pre-trial conference on June 22, 2016 at 09:20 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Cayli Peterson
Current: 411 S Center Ave, c/o Jefferson County Jail, Jefferson, WI 53549 United States  (Effective: 06-02-2016)
Prior: c/o Brown County Jail, 3030 Curry Lane, Green Bay, WI 54313 United States
to Cover both 16CF74 and 16CM154
Jefferson County Jail

Cases 16CF74 and 16CM154 called together at 1:33pm [mo]
Defendant Cayli R. Peterson appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, with Attorney Whitney Hagemann (PD will appoint counsel).  ADA Brookellen Teuber appears for the State of Wisconsin.  

On agreement of counsel, the Court finds that the videoconferencing system is sight and sound sufficient. 

As to Case 16CM154: 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited. 
Plea of "not guilty" entered; speedy trial waived by the Defendant

As to Case 16CF74:

Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited. 
Atty. Hagemann demands a speedy preliminary hearing

As to Both 16CM154 and 16CF74:

The Court requires a $500 CASH bond, with conditions:
--no possession or consumption of controlled substances
--no contact with Matthew Traver
--no possession of syringes or needles without valid precription
recess 1:47 pm. 


NEXT: (1) As to Case 16CF74: Preliminary Hearing on 6/10/16 at 8:30am 2) As to Both Cases: Pretrial Conference on 6/22/16 at 9:20am   (3) As to Case 16CM154: Status Conference on 7/8/16 at 11:00am
